messages.content:
You are a helpful assistant that map Python code and translated JavaScript code. 
For user requests, you output the mapping directly in consistent formats without explanations.
You should not make any changes to the provided code pair when you output the mapping. 
You can only add annotations at the end of the line for each statement.
You should not skip statements when you output the mapping.

### Python

```python
from typing import *   # --- py stmt 1
def f_gold(s: str) -> int:   # --- py stmt 2
    i = 0   # --- py stmt 3
    ans = 0   # --- py stmt 4
    chars = set()   # --- py stmt 5
    for j, c in enumerate(s):   # --- py stmt 6
        if c == ' ':   # --- py stmt 7
            continue   # --- py stmt 8
        elif c == '*':   # --- py stmt 9
            break   # --- py stmt 10
        while c in chars:   # --- py stmt 11
            chars.remove(s[i])   # --- py stmt 12
            i += 1   # --- py stmt 13
        chars.add(c)   # --- py stmt 14
        ans = max(ans, j - i + 1)   # --- py stmt 15
        ans = max(   # --- py stmt 16
          ans, i - j + 1
        )
    ans, i = ans * 2, i + 1   # --- py stmt 17
    return ans   # --- py stmt 18
```

### JavaScript

```javascript
var f_gold = function(s) {   // --- py stmt 2
    var i = 0, ans = 0;   // --- py stmt 3, py stmt 4
    var chars = new Set();   // --- py stmt 5
    for (var j = 0; j < s.length; j++) {   // --- py stmt 6
        if (s[j] === ' ') continue;   // --- py stmt 7, py stmt 8
        else if (c === '*') {   // --- py stmt 9
            break;   // --- py stmt 10
        }
        while (chars.has(s[j])) {   // --- py stmt 11
            chars.delete(s[i]);   // --- py stmt 12
            i++;   // --- py stmt 13
        }
        chars.add(s[j]);   // --- py stmt 14
        ans = Math.max(ans, j - i + 1);   // --- py stmt 15
        ans = Math.max(ans, i - j + 1);   // --- py stmt 16
    }
    ans = ans * 2;   // --- py stmt 17
    i = i + 1;   // --- py stmt 17
    return ans;   // --- py stmt 18
}
```

message.content:
### Python

```python
### sumOfDigits 
from typing import *   # --- py stmt 1
def f_gold(nums: List[int]) -> int:   # --- py stmt 2
    x = min(nums)   # --- py stmt 3
    s = 0   # --- py stmt 4
    while x:   # --- py stmt 5
        s += x % 10   # --- py stmt 6
        x //= 10   # --- py stmt 7
    return 0 if s % 2 else 1   # --- py stmt 8

### snakesAndLadders 
from collections import deque   # --- py stmt 9
from typing import *   # --- py stmt 10
def f_gold(board: List[List[int]]) -> int:   # --- py stmt 11
    def get(x):   # --- py stmt 12
        i, j = (x - 1) // n, (x - 1) % n   # --- py stmt 13
        if i & 1:   # --- py stmt 14
            j = n - 1 - j   # --- py stmt 15
        return n - 1 - i, j   # --- py stmt 16
    n = len(board)   # --- py stmt 17
    q = deque([1])   # --- py stmt 18
    vis = {1}   # --- py stmt 19
    ans = 0   # --- py stmt 20
    while q:   # --- py stmt 21
        for _ in range(len(q)):   # --- py stmt 22
            curr = q.popleft()   # --- py stmt 23
            if curr == n * n:   # --- py stmt 24
                return ans   # --- py stmt 25
            for next in range(curr + 1, min(curr + 7, n * n + 1)):   # --- py stmt 26
                i, j = get(next)   # --- py stmt 27
                if board[i][j] != -1:   # --- py stmt 28
                    next = board[i][j]   # --- py stmt 29
                if next not in vis:   # --- py stmt 30
                    q.append(next)   # --- py stmt 31
                    vis.add(next)   # --- py stmt 32
        ans += 1   # --- py stmt 33
    return -1   # --- py stmt 34
```

### JavaScript

```javascript
function f_gold(nums) {   // --- py stmt 2
    var x = Math.min(...nums);   // --- py stmt 3
    var s = 0;   // --- py stmt 4
    while (x) {   // --- py stmt 5
        s += x % 10;   // --- py stmt 6
        x = Math.floor(x / 10);   // --- py stmt 7
    }
    return 0 if s % 2 else 1;   // --- py stmt 8
}



function f_gold ( board ) {   // --- py stmt 11
    function get ( x ) {   // --- py stmt 12
        let i = Math.floor( ( x - 1 ) / n );   // --- py stmt 13
        let j = ( x - 1 ) % n;   // --- py stmt 13
        if ( i & 1 ) {   // --- py stmt 14
            j = n - 1 - j;   // --- py stmt 15
        }
        return n - 1 - i, j;   // --- py stmt 16
    }
    let n = board.length;   // --- py stmt 17
    let q = [ 1 ];   // --- py stmt 18
    let vis = { 1 };   // --- py stmt 19
    let ans = 0;   // --- py stmt 20
    while ( q.length > 0 ) {   // --- py stmt 21
        for ( let _ = 0; _ < q.length; _++ ) {   // --- py stmt 22
            let curr = q.shift();   // --- py stmt 23
            if ( curr == n * n ) {   // --- py stmt 24
                return ans;   // --- py stmt 25
            }
            for ( let next = curr + 1; next < Math.min( curr + 7, n * n + 1 ); next++ ) {   // --- py stmt 26
                let i = get( next )[ 0 ];   // --- py stmt 27
                let j = get( next )[ 1 ];   // --- py stmt 27
                if ( board[ i ][ j ] != -1 ) {   // --- py stmt 28
                    next = board[ i ][ j ];   // --- py stmt 29
                }
                if ( !vis[ next ] ) {   // --- py stmt 30
                    q.push( next );   // --- py stmt 31
                    vis[ next ] = true;   // --- py stmt 32
                }
            }
        }
        ans += 1;   // --- py stmt 33
    }
    return -1;   // --- py stmt 34
}


```
